creditline: Gift of Gabriel P. and Yvonne M.L. Weisberg
provenance: Sale, Importants tableaux XIXe et modernes dont une collection de tableaux d’Abel Lauvray, Hôtel Drouot, Paris, June 10, 1996;  [Neal Fiertag, Paris; to Weisberg]; Yvonne and Gabriel Weisberg, Minneapolis
signed: Lower center in black crayon: G d’E
text: Looking out at her audience with a serene half-smile, the cabaret singer Yvette Guilbert is gently lit from below by the stage footlights. A bonafide star, she performed at venues throughout Paris, including the Moulin Rouge. In his drawing, d’Espagnat eschews the dazzling lights and spectacle of a large performance in favor of a more intimate view of the singer in her signature long black gloves. Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec portrayed Gilbert again and again, publishing a book of sixteen portrait lithographs in 1894.
title: Yvette Guilbert Singing
